alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 5:34AM EDT until June 09 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM EDT FOR NORTHERN OCEAN AND NORTHEASTERN BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 534 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Woodruff, or 14 miles west of Toms River, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Beachwood, Presidential Lakes Estates, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Leisure Village, Six Flags Theme Park, Holiday City South, Pleasant Plains, Cedar Glen West, Jacksons Mills, Chatsworth, Leisure Village East, Dover Beaches South, Cassville, Vista Center, Woodruff and Holiday City-Berkeley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 18 and 25. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 78 and 90. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
